Reason: The configuration option 'cached_rows_fail_threshold' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the caching mechanism of rows in the system. A change in the value of this configuration can significantly affect the system's memory consumption and overall performance, as it determines when the system should fail to cache rows. Therefore, any notable variations in the value of 'cached_rows_fail_threshold' can lead to noticeable differences in execution time and memory usage, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
